page.title: 17TRANSPORT, HEMEL HEMPSTEAD
page.content: Hemel Hempstead is a centre for many sorts of transport because it lies on the route out of London going north. Nearby runs the M1 motorway which at present is undergoing repairs on a section and so as much traffic is being diverted to other roads such as A41 which passes through our area. The main west coast railway line passes through the area with stations at both Hemel and Apsley that serve the many commuters travelling to London each day to work. The most modern Inter-City passenger trains and fast freight trains use the line. Although it is used mainly for pleasure nowadays, the Grand Union Canal has been a major form of transport in the past, serving the paper mills of John Dickinson.
